1.text: A good name is more desirable than great riches; favor is better than silver and gold.

2.text: The rich and the poor have this in common: The LORD is Maker of them all.

3.text: The prudent see danger and take cover, but the simple keep going and suffer the consequences.

4.text: The rewards of humility and the fear of the LORD are wealth and honor and life.

5.text: Thorns and snares lie on the path of the perverse; he who guards his soul stays far from them.

6.text: Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.

7.text: The rich rule over the poor, and the borrower is slave to the lender.

8.text: He who sows injustice will reap disaster, and the rod of his fury will be destroyed.

9.text: A generous man will be blessed, for he shares his bread with the poor.

10.text: Drive out the mocker, and conflict will depart; even quarreling and insults will cease.

11.text: He who loves a pure heart and gracious lips will have the king for a friend.

12.text: The LORD’s eyes keep watch over knowledge, but He frustrates the words of the faithless.

13.text: The slacker says, “There is a lion outside! I will be slain in the streets!”

14.text: The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit; he who is under the wrath of the LORD will fall into it.

15.text: Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline drives it far from him.

16.text: Oppressing the poor to enrich oneself or giving gifts to the rich will surely lead to poverty.

17.text: Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise—apply your mind to my knowledge—

18.text: for it is pleasing when you keep them within you and they are constantly on your lips.

19.text: So that your trust may be in the LORD, I instruct you today—yes, you.

20.text: Have I not written for you thirty sayings about counsel and knowledge,

21.text: to show you true and reliable words, that you may soundly answer those who sent you?

22.text: Do not rob a poor man because he is poor, and do not crush the afflicted at the gate,

23.text: for the LORD will take up their case and will plunder those who rob them.

24.text: Do not make friends with an angry man, and do not associate with a hot-tempered man,

25.text: or you may learn his ways and entangle yourself in a snare.

26.text: Do not be one who gives pledges, who puts up security for debts.

27.text: If you have nothing with which to pay, why should your bed be taken from under you?

28.text: Do not move an ancient boundary stone which your fathers have placed.

29.text: Do you see a man skilled in his work? He will be stationed in the presence of kings; he will not stand before obscure men.
